Key Match Events: Juan Soto hit a three-run homer with two outs in the 10th inning, leading the Yankees to a 5-2 victory.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a two-run homer and was named ALCS MVP.
Luke Weaver got the final three outs with Lane Thomas flying out to right field for the last one, which was caught by Soto.
Post-Match Reflections: Yankees manager Aaron Boone praised Soto's performance and his impact on the team.
Soto expressed confidence during his at-bat, believing he had the advantage over the pitcher.
Yankees fans chanted 'Re-sign Soto!' during the postgame festivities.
Third baseman Jazz Chisolm Jr. humorously suggested a $700 million contract for Soto.
Giancarlo Stanton reflected on the team's resilience and the challenges they faced in the series.
Cleveland Guardians' manager Stephen Vogt expressed pride in his team's efforts despite the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees advanced to their 41st World Series and first in 15 years.
The Yankees will compete for their 28th title against either the New York Mets or Los Angeles Dodgers.
The Yankees' 82-80, fourth-place finish in the AL East last season led to organizational changes.
The Yankees acquired Juan Soto in a seven-player trade from San Diego in December.
Stanton's 16th postseason homer moved him into fourth place on the club's career list behind Bernie Williams, Derek Jeter, and Mickey Mantle.
Others: Yankees' LHP Nestor Cortes had another successful live batting practice session and is on track to join the World Series roster.
